index.description: The index starts at 0 when the device powers on for Electromechanical meters, and reflects the actual meter index if using mME. If 'E_POS and E_NEG' is activated, this variable will become an object in the format {e_pos: 1, e_neg: 2}

increments.description: Array containing the index increments. If recvTime is provided, it becomes a 2-dimensional array with JavaScript Date objects [[2024-08-02T19:30:00.000Z, 1], ...]. If 'E_POS and E_NEG' is activated, you will find two 2-dimensional arrays: first for OBIS code 1.8.0, second for OBIS code 2.8.0.

powers.description: Array containing the load curve values in W. If recvTime is provided, it becomes a 2-dimensional array with JavaScript Date objects [[2024-08-02T19:30:00.000Z, 1], ...]. If 'E_POS and E_NEG' is activated, you will find two 2-dimensional arrays.

indexes.description: Array containing the indexes. If recvTime is provided, it becomes a 2-dimensional array with JavaScript Date objects. If 'E_POS and E_NEG' is activated, you will find two 2-dimensional arrays.

meter_type.description: Electromechanical (Position A), mME (Position B) or Pulse

low_battery.description: 1 means the battery is low / 0 otherwise

firmware_version.description: Firmware version as an integer or string

number_of_starts.description: Number of starts of this sensor

time_step.description: Number of minutes for each measurement

obis.description: OBIS code description: 'E-POS values (OBIS code 1.8.0)' / 'E-SUM values (OBIS code 16.8.0)' / 'E-NEG values (OBIS code 2.8.0)' or combination for E_POS and E_NEG

redundancy.description: When activated, previous increments are repeated (only available in _ap products)

number_of_values.description: Number of measurement values in each T1 uplink (only available in _ap products)
